exemplars.name: Jamie Dimon
exemplars.track_record: CEO and Chairman of JPMorgan Chase; led bank through 2008 financial crisis; built largest US bank by assets; known for risk management expertise
exemplars.constraints: Faced unprecedented financial crisis; had to manage systemic risk while maintaining operations; dealt with regulatory scrutiny and public pressure
notable_actions: Steered JPMorgan through 2008 crisis while other major banks failed
Implemented comprehensive risk assessment frameworks across all business lines
Maintained strong capital reserves and liquidity buffers before crisis hit
Advocated for stress testing and scenario planning as standard risk practices
Built risk culture where risk officers had direct access to board and CEO

exemplars.name: Gary Cohn
exemplars.track_record: Former President and COO of Goldman Sachs; former Director of National Economic Council; known for risk management and trading expertise
exemplars.constraints: Managed risk during multiple market crises; operated in highly regulated financial sector; balanced risk-taking with prudent controls
notable_actions: Developed Goldman's risk management systems and trading controls
Implemented position limits and concentration risk controls
Built comprehensive market risk monitoring and reporting systems
Established risk committees with clear escalation protocols
Advocated for 'risk appetite' frameworks aligned with business strategy

exemplars.name: John Flint
exemplars.track_record: Former CEO of HSBC; former head of Retail Banking and Wealth Management; focused on risk governance and regulatory compliance
exemplars.constraints: Operated across multiple jurisdictions with complex regulatory requirements; managed global bank through post-crisis reforms; faced anti-money laundering compliance challenges
notable_actions: Strengthened HSBC's risk governance and compliance frameworks
Implemented enhanced anti-money laundering and sanctions screening
Reduced risk-weighted assets to improve capital efficiency
Established three lines of defense model for risk management
Prioritized regulatory remediation and compliance investments
